required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase II Study of Everolimus in Combination With Exemestane Versus Everolimus Alone Versus Capecitabine in Advance Breast Cancer.
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study of Everolimus in Combination With Exemestane Versus Everolimus Alone Versus Capecitabine in the Treatment of Postmenopausal Women With ER+Locally Advanced, Recurrent, or Metastatic Breast Cancer After Recurrence or Progression on Prior Letrozole or Anastrozole.

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the efficacy and tolerability of everolimus and capecitabine monotherapies compared to everolimus/exemestane combination in woman with ER + advanced breast cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a three-arm, randomized, open label, multi-center phase II study investigating the combination of everolimus (10mg daily) with exemestane (25mg daily) versus everolimus (10mg daily) versus capecitabine (1250mg/m2 twice daily for 14 days, 3-week cycle) in patients with estrogen-receptor positive, HER2 negative, advanced breast cancer after recurrence or progression on letrozole or anastrozole. The reference therapy (control arm) used in the course of this trial is the combination arm of everolimus plus exemestane. The investigational therapies in the context of this study are everolimus monotherapy and capecitabine monotherapy. All treatments will be taken orally until disease progression, intolerable toxicity or withdrawal of patient's informed consent. Patients will be randomly assigned with equal allocation to one of the treatment arms:
1. Exemestane (25mg daily) in combination with everolimus (10mg daily)
2. Everolimus (10mg daily)
3. Capecitabine (1250mg/m2 twice daily) orally for two weeks, followed by a one week rest period in 3-weeks cycles.
Treatment assignment will be stratified by the presence of visceral disease (yes vs. no). Visceral refers to lung, liver, heart, ovary, spleen, kidney, adrenal gland, malignant pleural or pericardial effusion or malignant ascites.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: 28 months after first patient randomized or once 150 PFS have occurred
primary_outcome.description: Once 150 PFS events have occured (determined by local assessment). To estimate the hazard ratio of PFS for everolimus plus exemestane versus everolimus alone in postmenopausal women with ER positive, HER2 negative, advanced breast cancer after recurrence or progression on letrozole or anastrozole.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 3 months following the end of study visit until 2015 (up to 3 years)
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the treatment groups with respect to Overall Survival. End of study visit is defined as time when progression of disease recorded or death whichever comes first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose of study medication until the date of the first documented disease progression or date of death from any cause whichever came first, assessed for approximately for 28 months
secondary_outcome.description: Overall response rate (ORR) based on the local radiologist/investigator's tumor assessment (RECIST 1.1)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose of study medication until the date of the first documented disease progression or date of death from any cause whichever came first, assessed for approximately 28 months
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Benefit Rate is defined as the proportion of patients with best overall response of complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) with duration of 24 weeks or longer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in ECOG (Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group) performance status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day 1, every 6 weeks for approximately 8 months
secondary_outcome.description: The ECOG performance status scale (1-5) allows patients to be classified as to their functional impairment, ECOG performance status will be compared to baseline ECOG performance classification.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life scores over time: EORTC (QLQ-C30)/EORTC module (BR23)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, every 6 weeks for approximately 8 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to quality of life (QoL)deterioration : TSQM score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every study visit for approximately 8 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety: Incidence of Serious Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every study visit for approximately 8 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety: changes in vital signs when compared to baseline vital signs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, every study visit for approximately 8 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety: changes in laboratory values compared to laboratory values obtained at the baseline visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, every study visit for approximately 8 months

arm_group.description: 100 patients will be randomized to the Capecitabine monotherapy arm (1250mg/m2 twice daily) orally for two weeks, followed by a one week rest period in 3-weeks cycles.
100 patients will be randomized to this arm and will received Everolimus (10mg daily).
100 patients will be randomized to the control arm of this study, everolimus (10mg daily) with exemestane (25mg daily).

intervention.description: Capecitabine, for oral use 1250 mg/m2 twice daily for 2 weeks followed by one week rest (3-week cycle). Capecitabine will be locally supplied by the Investigator.
Exemestane tablets of 25 mg will be taken orally once per day. Dose modifications in the management of adverse events is allowed.
Everolimus will be centrally dispensed via IWRS. Everolimus will be taken as oral tablets for oral use 10 mg (2 × 5 mg) daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Women with locally advanced, recurrent, or metastatic breast cancer along with confirmation of estrogen-receptor positive (ER+). Measurable disease defined as at least one lesion ≥ 10 mm by CT or MRI that can be accurately measured in at least one dimension (CT scan slice thickness ≤ 5 mm) OR • Bone lesions: lytic or mixed (lytic + blastic) in the absence of measurable disease as defined above
Exclusion Criteria:
-Patients who received more than one chemotherapy line. Patients with only non-measurable lesions other than lytic or mixed (lytic and blastic) bone metastasis.Previous treatment with exemestane, mTOR inhibitors, PI3K inhibitors or AKT inhibitors
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.
